TopicTitle: Do I need to accept "World's First" contracts?

Articles.Content:
As the topic says: Do I need to accept World's First contracts in order to be rewarded for them? The original release notes seem to suggest no.

Edited May 1, 2015 by KatzOhki
You don't need to accept them and they don't take up any of your contract slots. It will also assign and award you the next one during a mission if applicable.
Alright thanks, just asking because I've seen them pop up in my available contracts and didn't want to waste a contract slot.

some of them do, and some of them don't. The speed and distance records are automatically accepted and do not take up a contract slot, whereas things like rendezvous in kerbin orbit do need to be accepted and do take up a contract slot.
So the ones that pop up as available I DO need to accept then?

So the ones that pop up as available I DO need to accept then?

That is correct. The automatic ones take up no room at all, but the manual ones need a slot, and need to be manually accepted.
In fact if you fail to accept it and accomplish the requirements anyway you lose the contract, and the reward permanently.
